title: The Addition Principle
text: The Addition Principle of Counting is used when you want to find the total number of possible outcomes for two events that cannot happen at the same time (i.e., the events are mutually exclusive). In other words, if one event happens, the other cannot.

title: The Multiplication Principle
text: The Multiplication Principle of Counting is used when two events are independent of each other, meaning the occurrence of one event does not affect the occurrence of the other. This principle is applied when you want to calculate the total number of possible outcomes for two events that happen in sequence.
